name: Number of unlabeled set systems on n vertices which are closed under union of disjoint sets.
comment: A set system is a finite set of finite nonempty sets.
a(n) is also the number of non-isomorphic sets of subsets of an n-set which are closed under union of disjoint sets and which include the empty set.
example: Non-isomorphic representatives of the a(2) = 5 set-systems:
The a(3) = 22 non-isomorphic set-systems include A193674(3) = 19 set-systems that are closed under union and 3 additional set-systems which do not include {1,2,3}:
xref: Cf. A000612 (set-systems), A193674 (closed under union of sets), A381471, A381575 (labeled case).
author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 02 2025

name: Number of disjoint-union partial algebras with zero on [n].
comment: A disjoint-union partial algebra on a set S is a subset of the power set of S which is closed under union of disjoint sets.
A disjoint-union partial algebra with zero on a set S is a disjoint-union partial algebra on S which contains the empty set.

There are twice as many disjoint-union partial algebras on S as disjoint-union partial algebras with zero on S because the disjoint-union partial algebras without the empty set can be placed in bijection with those which have the empty set.
reference: Hirsch, R., & McLean, B. (2017). Disjoint-union partial algebras. Logical Methods in Computer Science, 13.
link: Robin Hirsch and Brett McLean, Disjoint-union partial algebras, arXiv:1612.00252 [math.RA], 2016-2017.
author: _Peter J. Taylor_, Feb 28 2025
